content.description: Fun problem up the arete.  The undercling crux is fun to pull into, and the problem tops out on good holds at the lip.
content.location: Same rock as The Crystal Method and U2 in the back of the Forest Area of The Beach.  Climb starts on the arête to the right of the white crystal plate.

content.description: Start sitting on the right side of the obvious low flake on the arete. Move up and then make a big move out right to a sloping crimp then back left to smaller holds. Finishes almost directly above the start.
content.protection: Pads. Landing is mostly flat. One rock on the right.
content.location: This boulder is visible from The Fin. From the Fin, look climber's left, it's maybe 30 yards away. Starts on the right side of the same flake that U2 starts on. U2 climbs straight up the arete, The Terrible stays right on the face.

content.description: Start in the crack on the right side of the face to the right of U2 and The Terrible. From the wide edge, launch to the sloper lip. Mantle to the top. Fun dyno.
content.protection: One pad, or two if you have them. Landing area slopes left.
content.location: At The Beach, Forest Area. On the large, obvious boulder uphill from The Warmup Boulder and The Finn.

content.description: A hard problem following a line of crimpy layaways on a 45 degree wall.  Starts matched on a pinch/sloper and bumps up through a series of crimps to a final throw to a sloper (or a jug, if you manage to huck past the sloper).  Great rock and cool moves.  And it's usually dry because it's so steep.
content.protection: 2 pads are nice - you slap your back pretty hard when you fall - but you're only 2 feet off the boulder behind you the whole time.
content.location: The huge boulder perched on top of another boulder to the left of the Fin (an obvious boulder - you'll know it when you see it).

content.description: Start sitting on low jug up and climb steep corner on sharp crimps. Make big move to committing jug with slab at your back. Hope you're not spent because there are a couple powerful moves left. Finish up corner to good mantle trying not to peal and/or dab.
content.protection: Two to three pads and a spotter ever though they can't help you from sliding all the way down into the hole.
content.location: Around the corner and down into a hole from Goicoechea on the down river side of boulder. There is a large tree laying across the slab boulder that's at you back.

content.description: Get from the juggy start (by the blocky jug start of right->left Brickwork) across the crystal streak (left->right) with good movement on smaller feet.
content.protection: Pads for sure, the crystal crimp flake flexed...
content.location: Same boulder as U2--left around the corner of U2. Start left of the crystal flake and traverse through it and finish up on the sidepull dyke of "The Crystal Method"

content.description: From the low flake on the left arête (same start as U2), climb up and left to the right side of the white crystal plate. Continue straight up on the painful side pulls with a finish via a reasonable mantle.
content.location: The Beach, Forest Area, on the boulder just uphill from The Fin.

content.description: Walk past Crystal Method and F*ck the Crystal to see blocky jugs on a wide face. Follow the jugs and inputs to the top. Goes up the best, blockiest granite jugs I've ever seen!
content.protection: A single pad with a good spotter.
content.location: The Beach, in the forest, across the river from Route 2 in Tumwater Canyon.  On the same boulder as U2 and F*ck the Crystal, just past the latter.
